title: Can I score 100 in maths by not doing RD Sharma and just by doing NCERT, exemplar, Arihant previous year in class 12? - Quora
tags: National Council of Educational Research and Training (NCERT)
Central Board of Secondary Education, India

response.answer_text: Definitely! Actually RD sharma or even exemplar are unnecessary. First and foremost read the theory of each chapter given in ncert. Look at carefully at every graph too. Watch a video about that particular topic or sub topic where you are struggling to understand the text. You can even ask your teachers. Then you should solve all ncert examples and then non repeated questions from the exercises. After this do previous year questions. If you do this much and don't make silly mistakes in the exam, you will definitely get 100. All the best for your exam! Ps - I didn't even do this much. I did ncert questions (about 60%), exemplar(45–55%), previous year(chapterwise and only the few questions which I thought could't do).

Yes, you can because quality is better than quantity. Through NCERT textbook all your basic concepts got clear. They are easy to read and understand and save a lots of time because of this approach. After completing the revision of NCERT books, you can go through exemplar as well as arihant previous year question papers. They will provide you an idea of the kind of questions asked in board exam. You can easily buy all these books from bookstores in the market as well as from online bookstores like mypustak. At mypustak you will get all kind of books free of cost at doorstep. Only the delivery charges you have to pay. #mypustak #booksforfree    Believe in yourself and give your best!!!!
Yes, but make sure you are studying twice or thrice for better practice and revision all the best stay home, stay safe
